cause.description:
Founded in 1984, CPAR works in partnership with vulnerable communities and diverse organizations to overcome poverty and build healthy communtiies in Africa.
CPAR supports community efforts to ensure access to clean water, adequate food supplies, primary health care services and a safe and healthy environment.
CPAR currently works exclusively in four countries in Eastern and Southern Africa: Ethiopia, Malawi, Tanzania and Uganda. All projects use a participatory community model and are implemented and monitored by CPAR field staff. 99% of CPAR staff are African and many themselves grew up in the communities with whom CPAR works.
1. We believe that health is created and sustained by social, environmental and economic factors.
